data.title: China has reached its 2020 solar power target three years ahead of schedule, eclipsing Europe
Australia plans random drug tests for people receiving welfare
Chinese fishermen get up to 4 years prison for illegally fishing more than 6000 sharks in Ecuador
Brazilian court blocks abolition of vast Amazon reserve
Fears of genocide as up to 3000 Rohingya muslims killed in Myanmar in last three days

Researchers have discovered traces of what could be the world’s oldest wine at the bottom of terracotta jars in a cave in Sicily, showing that the fermented drink was being made and consumed in Italy more than 6,000 years ago.
Next target Guam, North Korea says

Monsanto Calls for Investigation Into WHO Agency for Ignoring Monsanto-Funded Studies: Monsanto is attempting to take down a WHO agency that in 2015 linked the Monsanto product glyphosate to an increased risk of cancer in humans.
'Miracle' weed killer that was supposed to save farms is killing them instead - Controversial herbicide dicamba found to poison crops as well as pigweed chemical was intended to root out

Donald Trump Jr., has agreed to sit down for a transcribed interview with the Senate judiciary committee, as investigators continue to dig into his attendance at a 2016 meeting where he was promised Russian dirt on the Clinton campaign.
U.N. condemns 'outrageous' North Korea missile launch, Pyongyang says more to come
Young Conservative Party activists caught discussing 'gassing chavs' and 'shooting peasants' in leaked WhatsApp group
U.S. spacecraft readies for fiery plunge into Saturn after 13-year mission

Taj Mahal is Muslim tomb not Hindu temple, Indian court told | A court in India has heard testimony from government archaeologists that the Taj Mahal is a Muslim mausoleum built by a Mughal emperor to honour his dead wife – delivering an official riposte to claims it is a Hindu temple.
Historic 'living drug' gets go-ahead - The US has approved the first treatment to redesign a patient's own immune system so it attacks cancer.
